description: From balsam +‎ -ic and French balsamique. Doublet of balsamico and balmy.

entries.meaning: Having the health-giving properties of balsam; soothing, restorative.
examples: […]  the Souls of men also shall then catch life from the more pure and Balsamick parts of the Earth, and be cloathed again in terrestriall bodies  […]

entries.meaning: Having the pleasant odour of balsam; balmy, fragrant.
examples: he stood in the road, fragrant with the odor of the azaleas in the undergrowth and the balsamic breath of the low-hanging firs, which were all fibrously a-glitter wherever the moon touched the dew in the dense midst of their shadows.
